text: If you're working over a number field, the extrema points of the convex set should be numbers with coefficients in the number field.

elements.text: If you're working over a number field, the extrema points of the convex set should be numbers with coefficients in the number field.

text: Interesting… I guess that's because the extrema can be written as linear (polynomial?) combinations of coefficients in your number field?

elements.text: Interesting… I guess that's because the extrema can be written as linear (polynomial?) combinations of coefficients in your number field?

text: The extrema are given by equalities, so the extreme points are solutions of linear equations if I’m not mistaken.

elements.text: The extrema are given by equalities, so the extreme points are solutions of linear equations if I’m not mistaken.

text: Yeah. My point being is that it is probably not necessary to work with numerical approximation, but I am not sure whether that is efficient or not.

elements.text: Yeah. My point being is that it is probably not necessary to work with numerical approximation, but I am not sure whether that is efficient or not.
